title: Type ID.
content:
Seen in totally Dublin Magazine.

[http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v328/bobbykills/Picture2-4.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706171941/http:/img.photobucket.com/albums/v328/bobbykills/Picture2-4.png)

Ive been a fan of this font for ages, still dont have a clue what it is.

Thanks alot.

 [‹ type id- clean and modern](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706171941/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44923 "Go to previous forum topic") [ID: Is it a Myriad variation? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706171941/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44921 "Go to next forum topic")
author: bobbygrotesk

comments.content:
I think it’s Chalet (New York 1960) from House Industries

[http://www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=4&subpage=viewfonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706171941/http:/www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=4&subpage=viewfonts "http://www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=4&subpage=viewfonts")

its something between Avant Garde and Helvetica.. very beautiful, btw.

But it’s not Chalet..

Anybody knows?
Why shouldn’t it be Chalet? It sure looks exactly like it.

![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706171941im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Chalet-NewYorkNineteenSixty_6523.gif)

It is Chalet. Chalet New York Nineteen Sixty with -40 tracking.

Spot on.

Thank you all so much.

Just got the font there, its a beauty.
